snippet: The practice of sucking blood from a baby’s incision is defended by ultra-Orthodox rabbis, and the Bloomberg administration requirement that parents sign a consent form has been largely ignored.
abstract: Administration of New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio is close to compromise agreement with city's ultra-Orthodox Jewish community over health risks posed to newborns by circumcision ritual; new rule, which was prompted after some infants contracted herpes when rabbis sucked blood away from incision, would aim to better educate parents about health risks, while respecting their right to follow ritual.
lead_paragraph: The practice of sucking blood from a baby’s incision is defended by ultra-Orthodox rabbis, and the Bloomberg administration requirement that parents sign a consent form has been largely ignored.

headline.main: Mayor de Blasio and Rabbis Near Accord on New Circumcision Rule
headline.print_headline: Mayor and Rabbis Nearing Accord Over Teaching Circumcision Risk
